title: Why Bitcoin Miners Need to Take Ethereum Seriously - CoinDesk
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum have unique strengths and weaknesses, with Bitcoin as the original decentralization pioneer and Ethereum as a versatile platform for innovation. Both will play important roles in the future global financial system and society.

title: Polygon's zkEVM Beta Is Going Live on Ethereum Mainnet Next Month - Blockworks
summary: Polygon's zkEVM Beta is set to launch on Ethereum mainnet next month, according to a recent announcement. The layer-2 scaling solution promises faster transaction speeds than optimistic rollups and is the first "fully EVM equivalent" zk rollup to reach Ethereum mainnet. The launch is seen as a significant step towards scaling Ethereum and bringing Web3 to the masses. Other teams are also competing in the zkEVM race, with different approaches, but Polygon's zkEVM has been classified as a Type-3 by Vitalik Buterin due to its near EVM equivalence and choice to forgo precompiles. Security is the highest priority, and Polygon will be revealing more details about the Mainnet Beta over the next couple of weeks. At the time of writing, Polygon's MATIC token is trading at $1.23, up by over 4% in the past 24 hours.

title: OFAC-compliant blocks on Ethereum hit three-month low of 47% - Cointelegraph
summary: OFAC-compliant blocks on Ethereum have reached a three-month low of 47%, according to Cointelegraph. This marks a decline from the peak of 79% on Nov. 21. The percentage of blocks excluding transactions involving sanctioned parties by the US Treasury Department's Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC). The fall could be seen as a win for those opposing censorship within the Ethereum ecosystem. The decrease may be attributed to more validators using MEV-boost relays that don't censor transactions in accordance with OFAC requirements. Labrys, a blockchain consulting firm, created MEV Watch, which tracks the percentage of OFAC-compliant blocks. The Ethereum community has made progress addressing the issue since the Merge, but there is still more work to be done. OFAC sanctioned Ether and USD Coin wallet addresses using Tornado Cash in August. After the Merge, only 9% of blocks were OFAC-censored, but this figure increased sharply over the next two months.

title: Fewer Than Half of New Ethereum Blocks Over the Past 24 Hours Are OFAC Compliant - Yahoo Finance
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in under 256 tokens:

Ethereum's censorship rate has decreased significantly, with only 49% of blocks over the past 24 hours being OFAC-compliant. This is a reversal of the trend towards increased censorship following the US government's blacklisting of Tornado Cash transactions. The decrease is attributed to validators connecting to non-Flashbots relays, which are not censoring Tornado Cash transactions by default. There are now seven non-censoring relays, with BloXroute, Ultrasound, and Gnosis making up the majority of uncensored block space. While this is a positive development, the dependence on just a few entities raises concerns about the long-term sustainability of Ethereum's censorship resistance.

title: Ethereum Exchange Supply Has Fallen 37% Post Merge: Santiment - NewsBTC
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum exchange supply has fallen 37% since the Merge in September 2022, according to Santiment. This suggests that investors are continuing to leave exchanges, which can be bullish for the cryptocurrency. The chart shows a sharp decline in the exchange supply following the collapse of the crypto exchange FTX, and the price of Ethereum has also seen a decline in the past week. However, the noticeably sharper decline in the exchange supply may indicate that investors are accumulating more while ETH is at a "discount."

title: Bored Ape Owner Burns $169K NFT to Move It From Ethereum to Bitcoin - Decrypt
summary: A valuable digital collectible, BAYC #1626, was permanently removed from circulation as its owner aimed to symbolically shift the asset's underlying blockchain from Ethereum to Bitcoin. The collectible was burned using a new feature called Teleburn, which allows users to assign an existing asset from another network to a Bitcoin Inscription while removing it from circulation. The move has sparked discussion in the NFT community, with some seeing it as a way to bridge digital collectibles across chains, while others question the legitimacy of the burned asset. The owner of BAYC #1626 believes the Ape now exists on Bitcoin, while Yuga Labs, the creator of the Bored Ape Yacht Club, states that the Inscription linked to the Ape is an unlicensed reproduction since the owner no longer maintains its possession on Ethereum's network. The development of the Teleburn function has the potential to change the way digital collectibles are traded and valued, but it remains to be seen how the market will respond to this new approach.

title: EY contributes the beta version of zero-knowledge-proof compiler Starlight to the public domain to enable secure ... - EY
summary: EY has released the beta version of Starlight, a zero-knowledge proof (ZKP) compiler, to the public domain to enable secure and private business logic on the Ethereum blockchain. Starlight bridges the knowledge and development gap for zero-knowledge applications (zkApps) by making it easier for developers to integrate privacy features into decentralized applications. The tool supports complex business agreements where privacy is critical but sharing data between parties is necessary. With Starlight, developers can migrate B2B business agreements from private portals to the public Ethereum network while retaining privacy and security.

title: Crypto Startup Monad Labs Aims to Create Next ‘Ethereum Killer’ After Raising $19M - CoinDesk
summary: Crypto startup Monad Labs raised $19M to create a new blockchain, called Monad, which aims to be the next "Ethereum killer." The blockchain will use a proof-of-stake consensus mechanism and be compatible with Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) software, allowing for interoperability with Ethereum-based projects. The Monad blockchain will launch on a testnet soon, with mainnet deployment planned for later this year.

title: Ethereum's $1.5K support weakens as ETH traders turn slightly bearish - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum's price has been range trading near $1,500, with a 10.2% decline between Jan. 8 and Jan. 10. Derivatives metrics show a shift towards a neutral-to-bearish sentiment, with slowing demand for leverage longs and a flirtation with the bearish 10% level for the 25% delta skew. The SEC's lawsuits and enforcement actions against crypto firms are a concern for investors, and a crackdown on crypto staking could have unintended consequences for decentralized finance. However, the pre-launch of the Shanghai upgrade on the Zhejiang testnet is seen as a positive development. Overall, the odds favor Ether bears due to the hostile regulatory environment and the potential amplification of FUD.

title: Bored Ape Owner Burns $169K NFT to Move It From Ethereum to Bitcoin - Yahoo Finance
summary:

Bored Ape owner burns $169K NFT to move it from Ethereum to Bitcoin.

* The move symbolically shifts the asset's underlying blockchain from Ethereum to Bitcoin.
* Ordinals, created by Casey Rodarmor, is a project that allows content like videos and images to be assigned to individual satoshis on Bitcoin's network.
* The burned Ape now exists on Bitcoin, and its owner believes it will carry a lot of value due to its first-of-a-kind nature.
* The move has sparked discussion on the potential for bridging digital collectibles across different chains.
* Yuga Labs, the creator of Bored Apes, believes the Inscription of BAYC

title: Ethereum-based ICONOMI Raises over $10.5 Million in ICO - CCN.com
summary: ICONOMI, an Ethereum-based investment fund platform, raised over $10.5 million in its Initial Coin Offering (ICO) last month, setting a record for the 11th largest crowdsale in history. The company raised $8.9 million in operational capital and equity through the ICO and plans to use the remaining funds to expand its development, including hiring, office space, and growing two funds: ICONOMI.INDEX and ICONOMI.PERFORMANCE. The funds will be used to invest in cryptocurrencies and provide weekly dividends to investors. The company aims to revolutionize the financial sector by offering a disintermediated alternative to the multi-billion fund management industry.

title: “Blockchain is still an incredibly hot technology. We excised some cancers from the body and feel a lot better” - CTech
summary: Blockchain and crypto have faced a tumultuous year, with a $2 trillion value wipeout and key industry players collapsing. However, Joe Lubin, co-founder of Ethereum and founder of ConsenSys, remains optimistic about the sector's outlook. Despite the reputational hit, Lubin believes the industry is in a great position, with software developers and builders staying in the ecosystem, while speculators come and go. He compares the current situation to the early days of the internet, where there were also skeptics but the technology continued to advance. Lubin also highlights the benefits of decentralization and transparency, citing the example of the FTX untangling process, which is being done on an open database, as a positive for the industry.

title: Monad Labs raises $19M to grow its smart contract platform and improve the Ethereum space - TechCrunch
summary: Monad Labs, a startup focused on improving the Ethereum space, has raised $19M in seed funding to grow its smart contract platform. The platform, which is EVM-compatible, aims to increase throughput on the Ethereum blockchain and provide a more optimized system for smart contracts. The team, which has experience in building low-latency, high-frequency trading systems, believes that the current limitations of the Ethereum ecosystem can be addressed through fundamental improvements. The capital raised will be used to double the team size and enter a testnet phase in the coming months, with a mainnet launch later this year.

title: Blur Launches Long-Awaited Token Airdrop for Ethereum NFT Traders - Yahoo Finance
summary: Blur, a rival to OpenSea in the NFT market, is launching a long-awaited token airdrop for Ethereum NFT traders. The airdrop is set to begin today, with users eligible for the BLUR tokens based on their trading activity on the platform. The marketplace had initially planned to drop the governance token in January but delayed the airdrop to today. The token airdrop is part of Blur's strategy to build an audience by offering potentially valuable token rewards to traders. However, the hype around token rewards has also prompted suspicion of "wash trading" on the platform. The article also mentions that NFT sales have jumped 38% in January, with Blur sometimes topping OpenSea in terms of NFT trading volume.

title: What is Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade? What's IN and Out - CoinGape
summary: The Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade is scheduled to occur in March 2023 and will enable validators and stakes to remove assets from the beacon chain. This upgrade will have significant impacts on the Ethereum network, including increased liquidity and the potential for a change in market demand. The upgrade will allow users to withdraw their staked assets, which could lead to a decrease in the proportion of tokens staked out of the total supply. The Shanghai update will also provide users with the ability to test the upgrade on a public test network by the end of February 2023. Overall, the upgrade is expected to benefit users by providing better staking circumstances and increasing the liquidity of staked ETH.

title: Blur Launches Long-Awaited Token Airdrop for Ethereum NFT Traders - Decrypt
summary: Blur, a rival to OpenSea in the NFT marketplace, is launching a delayed airdrop of BLUR tokens today to reward Ethereum NFT traders. The marketplace has granted users "care packages" representing token allotments, which can be claimed today. Blur raised $11 million in a seed round and is offering token rewards to build an audience. However, there are concerns about "wash trading" on the platform as users manipulate trades to boost rewards. Notable crypto exchanges have announced plans to support the BLUR token once it starts trading.

title: Bitcoin NFTs are growing quickly as community sees long-term potential - TechCrunch
summary: Bitcoin NFTs are gaining traction as the community sees long-term potential. Ordinals, an NFT-like project on the Bitcoin blockchain, has seen over 90,000 inscriptions in the past month, with a recent all-time high of 20,000 inscriptions in a single day. While still in its early stages, Bitcoin NFTs have the potential to compete with major NFT ecosystems like Ethereum and Solana. However, infrastructure, communities, and trading platforms are still in development, and accessibility remains a significant challenge. Marketplaces like Gamma are launching to help with inscription and trading, and more capital and developers are entering the space. As the ecosystem develops, there is potential for Bitcoin NFTs to become a major player in the cryptocurrency market.

title: How crypto staking connects to financial censorship - Axios
summary:
Kraken, a cryptocurrency exchange, has faced legal action from the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) over its staking program, which allows users to participate in the validation of transactions on the Ethereum blockchain. The SEC has deemed the program an unregistered security, and Kraken has agreed to shut it down. This development has implications for the broader cryptocurrency industry, as it highlights the tension between blockchain networks and nation-states in terms of international sanctions.

Last year, the Office of Foreign Asset Control (OFAC) imposed sanctions on a smart contract called Tornado Cash, which was frequently used by criminals and hostile nation-states. In response, some cryptocurrency exchanges, including Kraken, have been censoring transactions that touch Tornado Cash or other suspicious addresses. However, not all validators are complying with these sanctions, and the proportion of blocks that censor transactions has been dropping, according to MEVWatch, a site that tracks blockchain censorship.

The situation raises questions about the political neutrality of cryptocurrency and the extent to which it

title: Cryptocurrency price in India 14 February 2023: Bitcoin at $21,714.77, Ethereum falls 1.17%, market remains in the red - India Today
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Cryptocurrency prices in India were down on February 14, with Bitcoin at $21,714.77 and Ethereum falling 1.17%. The global crypto market cap decreased by 1%, and total crypto market volume saw an increase of 34.34%. Top gainers and losers included Curve DAO Token, GMX, Maker, and Aave, while Shiba Inu, Dogecoin, and Dogelon Mars saw decreases. Metaverse tokens like Decentraland, Axie Infinity, and The Sandbox also saw declines.

title: NFT Traders Flex Their Blur Airdrops: Here’s Who Got the Most Tokens - Decrypt
summary: NFT traders are flexing their muscles in the Blur airdrop, with some claiming over $1 million worth of tokens. The top trader took home over $1.9 million worth of tokens, while other notable claimants include well-known collectors and social media personalities. The airdrop distributed 360 million BLUR tokens, with nearly 260 million claimed so far. However, the token's value has dropped sharply, down 88% from its short-lived peak.

title: Coinbase to fight for the industry if SEC goes after Bitcoin and Ethereum staking in US – Report - Crypto News Flash
summary: Coinbase is fighting against potential SEC regulation on staking services, claiming they are not securities. Brian Armstrong, CEO, stated that Coinbase's staking services do not meet the Howey test elements and will defend this in court if needed. Coinbase's staking services are protocol-based and on-chain, different from other products in the market. The exchange is urging the SEC to get it right with staking regulation, as incorrect regulation could harm proof of stake technology in the US. Coinbase defines its staking services as vital to crypto and blockchain technologies, and staking in general is not a security, according to the company.

title: The Present and Future of Layer 2 Rollup - The Cryptonomist
summary: Layer 2 (L2) rollup solutions have gained popularity as Ethereum network activity grows, driven by NFTs and DeFi. Gas costs and transaction finality have increased due to network load, but the Ethereum Merge set the groundwork for future gas fee optimizations. Optimistic and Zero-Knowledge (ZK) rollups help reduce computational demands on the Ethereum network by moving transactions off-chain, bundling them, and submitting them as a single piece of data. ZK-rollups have the advantage of always reflecting a correct L2 state, but require proofs for all state transitions, which limits scalability. ZK-rollup space is focused on StarkNet, zkSync, Polygon zkEVM, and Scroll, with each project taking a different angle on data availability and proving algorithms. Challenges include language compatibility, secretive nature of projects, and decentralization. Projects plan to decentralize sequencer functions and tokenize services to generate activity and decentralize products. The future of zkEVMs is competitive, with projects like StarkNet, zkSync, and Polygon zk
